Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with traces of two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion (one hind leg remaining) to left; below, two narrow brown bands.
Curator's comments: The Mature Animal Style is usually characterised by filling ornament; its lack here may be due merely to the small size of the fragment.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0447) (phase 2)
